normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Vendor Audits Tightened Post-Diwali Surge

unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Vendor Audits Tightened Post-Diwali Surge**
normalised: Mumbai, November sixteen, two thousand and twenty three – Following a significant uptick in demand during the Diwali season, several leading Indian manufacturing firms are intensifying vendor audits to ensure quality and compliance. Concerns have arisen regarding potential compromises made to meet heightened production targets during the festival rush.

unnormalised: Mumbai, Nov 16, 2023 – Following a significant uptick in demand during the Diwali season, several leading Indian manufacturing firms are intensifying vendor audits to ensure quality and compliance. Concerns have arisen regarding potential compromises made to meet heightened production targets during the festival rush.
normalised: "We saw a thirty percent increase in orders for our consumer electronics line leading up to Diwali," stated Miss Priya Sharma, Supply Chain Head at Tata Consumer Products. "To maintain timely delivery, some vendors may have relaxed their internal quality checks. This is why we are conducting thorough audits across our supply base in Maharashtra and Karnataka."

unnormalised: "We saw a 30% increase in orders for our consumer electronics line leading up to Diwali," stated Ms. Priya Sharma, Supply Chain Head at Tata Consumer Products. normalised: Audits will focus on material sourcing, labor practices, and adherence to safety regulations as per B I S standards. Any non-compliance could result in penalties or even termination of contracts. Furthermore, the increased consumption of biryani and sweets during the festive period also led to a spike in raw material demand for the food processing industry, prompting similar audit drives there. Specifically, supplier adherence to F S S A I guidelines will be scrutinized. The exercise is expected to conclude by December fifteen, two thousand and twenty three.
